meanings.definition: The act of moving back and forth or from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The swingings of the pendulum were mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent2: The swingings of the branches in the wind created a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The swingings of the boat made everyone giggle as they tried to keep their balance.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like the swingings of a pendulum, constantly shifting.
meanings.sent5: The swingings of the playground swing brought back nostalgic memories of childhood.

meanings.definition: A series of repeated movements or changes in direction.
meanings.sent1: The swingings of the metronome kept the musicians in perfect time.
meanings.sent2: The swingings of the door indicated someone was coming in and out frequently.
meanings.sent3: The swingings of the yo-yo were so rapid, it almost looked like magic.
meanings.sent4: The swingings of the clock's pendulum marked the passing of each second.
meanings.sent5: The swingings of the dancer's arms added grace to her performance.

meanings.definition: A lively or energetic style of music or dance.
meanings.sent1: The swingings of the jazz band got everyone on their feet dancing.
meanings.sent2: The swingings of the salsa music filled the room with vibrant energy.
meanings.sent3: The swingings of the hula dancer's hips were a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The swingings of the rock concert had the crowd jumping and cheering.
meanings.sent5: The swingings of the tap dancer's feet echoed through the theater.
